author: Vonng (rh@vonng.com)
description: PostgreSQL Cluster Dashboard for Remote Clusters

panels.description: cls = ${cls}. Used as an unique cluster identifier and resource namespace.
panels.title: Cluster

panels.description: ip = ${ip}. Unique identifier for corresponding node
panels.title: CLS ID

panels.description: Replication Facts about this instance: In recovery, In sync commit mode, has replication descendant. has publication, has subscription

targets.expr: count by (ins)(pg_pubrel_count{ins="$primary"}) > bool 0 or on() vector(0)

panels.description: Important configuration entries of this instance
panels.title: Configuration

value.title: PGSQL Instance for replication source instance ${__data.fields.SRC}
PGSQL Instance for replication destination instance ${__data.fields.DST}

panels.description:
Overall pressure for this PostgreSQL Node and Instance. 
max(node:ins:cpu_usage, pg:ins:load, pgbouncer:ins:load)

links.title: PGSQL Replication Detail in seconds for Cluster ${cls}
PGSQL Replication lag in bytes for Cluster ${cls}
PGSQL Session : PG Conn Usage for ${ins}.${datname}

panels.description: Alerting event graph. Each stripe represent an alerting Event. Gray transparent stipe are pending alerts.

list.description: Cluster identifier for this postgres instance, cls should be unique among entire environment. such as pg-meta, pg-test
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cls

title: PGSQL Cluster (Remote)
